intro: Silene trachyphylla, commonly known as the roughleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. Silene trachyphylla is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
